summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 where New York Times reporter Matthew Goldstein inquires about a story regarding Deutsche Bank's control of billions in assets belonging to Epstein's Financial Trust Company and its potential bankruptcy court action. The initial response from an unknown recipient expresses skepticism and is the first they are hearing about the claim.

persons.name: Matthew Goldstein
persons.context: A New York Times reporter who is inquiring about a story regarding Deutsche Bank's control of assets for Epstein's Financial Trust Company and potential bankruptcy court action.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the individual whose customers' assets are controlled by Deutsche Bank via the Financial Trust Company, and who was reportedly trading currencies through Deutsche Bank until his arrest.

connections.description: Goldstein is investigating and reporting on financial matters related to Epstein and his associated entities.

events.title: Inquiry about Epstein's Deutsche Bank assets
events.description: New York Times reporter Matthew Goldstein sends an email inquiry about Deutsche Bank controlling billions in assets for Epstein's Financial Trust Company and considering bankruptcy court action.

events.title: Response to Epstein asset inquiry
events.description: An unknown recipient responds to the inquiry, stating it is the first they are hearing about the Deutsche Bank/Epstein asset claim and expresses skepticism about its truth.

keyFacts: Deutsche Bank reportedly controlled several billion dollars in assets belonging to Epstein's Financial Trust Company on behalf of Epstein's customers.
Epstein was reportedly trading currencies through Deutsche Bank for his clients until his arrest.
Deutsche Bank was reportedly considering going to bankruptcy court to take control of these assets and was coordinating efforts with an unspecified office.
The email shows media inquiry into Epstein's financial network and assets shortly after his arrest in July 2019.
The initial response suggests the information was not widely known or confirmed at the time.
